headline: The Home Depot of Beauty: How Ulta Built An $11 Billion Empire By Hiding In Plain Sight
summary: Ulta Beauty (NASDAQ:ULTA) is one of the largest beauty retailers in the country, but it’s far from the flashiest. Tucked into the back corners of strip malls and nestled into small town shopping centers around the country, the retailer has built a 1,500-store, $11 billion empire by being the unassuming workhorse of the beauty industry. Which is exactly how founders Richard George and Terry Hanson designed it, Bloomberg says. The Ulta Story George and Hanson met while working in the corporate off

headline: Why The Narrative Around Ulta Beauty Is Shifting After Fresh Earnings Beats And Growth Moves
summary: Ulta Beauty's intrinsic value has been nudged higher, with the fair value estimate climbing from about $575 per share to roughly $603 as analysts grow more confident in the retailer's ability to sustain its earnings edge. Slightly stronger long term revenue growth assumptions, supported by the Space NK acquisition and ongoing demand resilience, are enough to justify this modest upgrade even as a higher discount rate signals a bit more perceived risk.
